We are hashtag#hiring for a leading Oil and Gas Construction Company in Oman.Designation: GRE- QC InspectorVacancies: 03 Nos.Qualification & Experience:* Shall be a Graduate/Diploma Engineer in Mechanical/Metallurgical or equivalent discipline. * Experienced in GRE Bonding & Lamination works & trained by reputed GRE manufacturers like FGS/ CPI/ FPI etc.* Having PDO approval / Project experience will be an added advantage.* Certification as CSWIP 3.1 or AWS / BGAS painting/ NACE/ equivalent and Certified to ASNT level II in RT, PT, MT and UT techniques shall be given preference.* Shall have a minimum of 6 years of relevant inspection experience in oil and gas facility /GRE Pipeline /Piping construction. * Shall be familiar with relevant material, Testing, Instruments used & construction/works codes used in the industry & field of activity.Duties & Responsibilities:* Implementation, and monitoring of the Project specific Contract Quality Plan/ITP/QCP etc.* Witness procedures, Bonder qualifications, tests and certify the results.* Maintaining of Quality records & assists in preparation of Hand over package/ dossiers.* Reporting Quality activities, monitor performance indicators.* Liaison with Client representatives on matters related to Quality.* Assists in Auditing - internal and external, and follow up of Corrective Actions (internal & external).* Monitor & Control of Sub-Contractorâ€™s Activities and their quality performance.* Provide sufficient feedback to QA/QC Engineer on the day-to-day quality issues# Job Location: Oman, Site Based# Job Duration: Long Term (2+ Years)# Salary: As per Company standard, based on years of experience, current/last CTC# Other Benefits: To and Fro Air Tickets, food, accommodation, transportation, medicals, leave salary and gratuity.* Interested candidates meeting the qualification and experience criteria are invited to submit their updated resumes to career@everserveconsultants.com.Follow Naveen Kanchan & EverServe Consultants Private Limited, for great opportunities!hashtag#jobvacancy hashtag#omanjobs hashtag#jobhiring hashtag#oilandgasjobs hashtag#constructionjobs hashtag#qaqc hashtag#inspectors hashtag#quality hashtag#qajobs hashtag#gre hashtag#glassreinforcedepoxy

We are hashtag#hiring for a leading Oil and Gas Construction Company in Oman.Designation: GRE- QC InspectorVacancies: 03 Nos.Qualification & Experience:* Shall be a Graduate/Diploma Engineer in Mechanical/Metallurgical or equivalent discipline. * Experienced in GRE Bonding & Lamination works & trained by reputed GRE manufacturers like FGS/ CPI/ FPI etc.* Having PDO approval / Project experience will be an added advantage.* Certification as CSWIP 3.1 or AWS / BGAS painting/ NACE/ equivalent and Certified to ASNT level II in RT, PT, MT and UT techniques shall be given preference.* Shall have a minimum of 6 years of relevant inspection experience in oil and gas facility /GRE Pipeline /Piping construction. * Shall be familiar with relevant material, Testing, Instruments used & construction/works codes used in the industry & field of activity.Duties & Responsibilities:* Implementation, and monitoring of the Project specific Contract Quality Plan/ITP/QCP etc.* Witness procedures, Bonder qualifications, tests and certify the results.* Maintaining of Quality records & assists in preparation of Hand over package/ dossiers.* Reporting Quality activities, monitor performance indicators.* Liaison with Client representatives on matters related to Quality.* Assists in Auditing - internal and external, and follow up of Corrective Actions (internal & external).* Monitor & Control of Sub-Contractorâ€™s Activities and their quality performance.* Provide sufficient feedback to QA/QC Engineer on the day-to-day quality issues# Job Location: Oman, Site Based# Job Duration: Long Term (2+ Years)# Salary: As per Company standard, based on years of experience, current/last CTC# Other Benefits: To and Fro Air Tickets, food, accommodation, transportation, medicals, leave salary and gratuity.* Interested candidates meeting the qualification and experience criteria are invited to submit their updated resumes to career@everserveconsultants.com.Follow Naveen Kanchan & EverServe Consultants Private Limited, for great opportunities!hashtag#jobvacancy hashtag#omanjobs hashtag#jobhiring hashtag#oilandgasjobs hashtag#constructionjobs hashtag#qaqc hashtag#inspectors hashtag#quality hashtag#qajobs hashtag#gre hashtag#glassreinforcedepoxy

We are hashtag#hiring for a leading Oil and Gas Construction Company in Oman.Designation: GRE- QC InspectorVacancies: 03 Nos.Qualification & Experience:* Shall be a Graduate/Diploma Engineer in Mechanical/Metallurgical or equivalent discipline. * Experienced in GRE Bonding & Lamination works & trained by reputed GRE manufacturers like FGS/ CPI/ FPI etc.* Having PDO approval / Project experience will be an added advantage.* Certification as CSWIP 3.1 or AWS / BGAS painting/ NACE/ equivalent and Certified to ASNT level II in RT, PT, MT and UT techniques shall be given preference.* Shall have a minimum of 6 years of relevant inspection experience in oil and gas facility /GRE Pipeline /Piping construction. * Shall be familiar with relevant material, Testing, Instruments used & construction/works codes used in the industry & field of activity.Duties & Responsibilities:* Implementation, and monitoring of the Project specific Contract Quality Plan/ITP/QCP etc.* Witness procedures, Bonder qualifications, tests and certify the results.* Maintaining of Quality records & assists in preparation of Hand over package/ dossiers.* Reporting Quality activities, monitor performance indicators.* Liaison with Client representatives on matters related to Quality.* Assists in Auditing - internal and external, and follow up of Corrective Actions (internal & external).* Monitor & Control of Sub-Contractorâ€™s Activities and their quality performance.* Provide sufficient feedback to QA/QC Engineer on the day-to-day quality issues# Job Location: Oman, Site Based# Job Duration: Long Term (2+ Years)# Salary: As per Company standard, based on years of experience, current/last CTC# Other Benefits: To and Fro Air Tickets, food, accommodation, transportation, medicals, leave salary and gratuity.* Interested candidates meeting the qualification and experience criteria are invited to submit their updated resumes to career@everserveconsultants.com.Follow Naveen Kanchan & EverServe Consultants Private Limited, for great opportunities!hashtag#jobvacancy hashtag#omanjobs hashtag#jobhiring hashtag#oilandgasjobs hashtag#constructionjobs hashtag#qaqc hashtag#inspectors hashtag#quality hashtag#qajobs hashtag#gre hashtag#glassreinforcedepoxy

Username: EverServe Consultants Private LimitedEverServe Consultants Private Limited

We are hashtag#hiring for a leading Oil and Gas Construction Company in Oman.Designation: GRE- QC InspectorVacancies: 03 Nos.Qualification & Experience:* Shall be a Graduate/Diploma Engineer in Mechanical/Metallurgical or equivalent discipline. * Experienced in GRE Bonding & Lamination works & trained by reputed GRE manufacturers like FGS/ CPI/ FPI etc.* Having PDO approval / Project experience will be an added advantage.* Certification as CSWIP 3.1 or AWS / BGAS painting/ NACE/ equivalent and Certified to ASNT level II in RT, PT, MT and UT techniques shall be given preference.* Shall have a minimum of 6 years of relevant inspection experience in oil and gas facility /GRE Pipeline /Piping construction. * Shall be familiar with relevant material, Testing, Instruments used & construction/works codes used in the industry & field of activity.Duties & Responsibilities:* Implementation, and monitoring of the Project specific Contract Quality Plan/ITP/QCP etc.* Witness procedures, Bonder qualifications, tests and certify the results.* Maintaining of Quality records & assists in preparation of Hand over package/ dossiers.* Reporting Quality activities, monitor performance indicators.* Liaison with Client representatives on matters related to Quality.* Assists in Auditing - internal and external, and follow up of Corrective Actions (internal & external).* Monitor & Control of Sub-Contractorâ€™s Activities and their quality performance.* Provide sufficient feedback to QA/QC Engineer on the day-to-day quality issues# Job Location: Oman, Site Based# Job Duration: Long Term (2+ Years)# Salary: As per Company standard, based on years of experience, current/last CTC# Other Benefits: To and Fro Air Tickets, food, accommodation, transportation, medicals, leave salary and gratuity.* Interested candidates meeting the qualification and experience criteria are invited to submit their updated resumes to career@everserveconsultants.com.Follow Naveen Kanchan & EverServe Consultants Private Limited, for great opportunities!hashtag#jobvacancy hashtag#omanjobs hashtag#jobhiring hashtag#oilandgasjobs hashtag#constructionjobs hashtag#qaqc hashtag#inspectors hashtag#quality hashtag#qajobs hashtag#gre hashtag#glassreinforcedepoxy

We are hashtag#hiring for a leading Oil and Gas Construction Company in Oman.Designation: GRE- QC InspectorVacancies: 03 Nos.Qualification & Experience:* Shall be a Graduate/Diploma Engineer in Mechanical/Metallurgical or equivalent discipline. * Experienced in GRE Bonding & Lamination works & trained by reputed GRE manufacturers like FGS/ CPI/ FPI etc.* Having PDO approval / Project experience will be an added advantage.* Certification as CSWIP 3.1 or AWS / BGAS painting/ NACE/ equivalent and Certified to ASNT level II in RT, PT, MT and UT techniques shall be given preference.* Shall have a minimum of 6 years of relevant inspection experience in oil and gas facility /GRE Pipeline /Piping construction. * Shall be familiar with relevant material, Testing, Instruments used & construction/works codes used in the industry & field of activity.Duties & Responsibilities:* Implementation, and monitoring of the Project specific Contract Quality Plan/ITP/QCP etc.* Witness procedures, Bonder qualifications, tests and certify the results.* Maintaining of Quality records & assists in preparation of Hand over package/ dossiers.* Reporting Quality activities, monitor performance indicators.* Liaison with Client representatives on matters related to Quality.* Assists in Auditing - internal and external, and follow up of Corrective Actions (internal & external).* Monitor & Control of Sub-Contractorâ€™s Activities and their quality performance.* Provide sufficient feedback to QA/QC Engineer on the day-to-day quality issues# Job Location: Oman, Site Based# Job Duration: Long Term (2+ Years)# Salary: As per Company standard, based on years of experience, current/last CTC# Other Benefits: To and Fro Air Tickets, food, accommodation, transportation, medicals, leave salary and gratuity.* Interested candidates meeting the qualification and experience criteria are invited to submit their updated resumes to career@everserveconsultants.com.Follow Naveen Kanchan & EverServe Consultants Private Limited, for great opportunities!hashtag#jobvacancy hashtag#omanjobs hashtag#jobhiring hashtag#oilandgasjobs hashtag#constructionjobs hashtag#qaqc hashtag#inspectors hashtag#quality hashtag#qajobs hashtag#gre hashtag#glassreinforcedepoxy

Majority Of Canadians say refugees receive too many benefits A growing number of Canadians believe refugees and asylum seekers receive excessive government benefits, according to internal research by the Canadian Museum for Human Rights. Blacklock's Reporter says the findings align with a decline in public support for high immigration levels, as documented by the Department of Immigration.A report titledÂ Foresights For Human Rights: 2024 Preliminary Reportfound that 56% of respondents felt refugees and asylum seekers were granted too many benefits. Additionally, 41% believed there was too much emphasis on newcomersâ€™ rights.Public sentiment about immigrationâ€™s impact has shifted significantly. When asked if â€œimmigrants make the country better,â€ only 44% agreed, down from 52% the previous year. The report noted a growing perception that immigration is linked to economic strain. â€œMore research is needed to understand the roots of this trend,â€ it stated.The study also found that 84% of respondents agreed with the statement: â€œRefugee applicants receive too many benefits that would be better used by Canadians.â€Read Article:https://lnkd.in/dauksgKchashtag#Opines on hashtag#CanadianPolitics hashtag#CanadianImmigrationhashtag#STOPMASSIMMIGRATIONhashtag#CanadianOpiner by hashtag#OpineMediaGroup

We are hashtag#hiring for a leading Oil and Gas Construction Company in Oman.Designation: GRE- QC InspectorVacancies: 03 Nos.Qualification & Experience:* Shall be a Graduate/Diploma Engineer in Mechanical/Metallurgical or equivalent discipline. * Experienced in GRE Bonding & Lamination works & trained by reputed GRE manufacturers like FGS/ CPI/ FPI etc.* Having PDO approval / Project experience will be an added advantage.* Certification as CSWIP 3.1 or AWS / BGAS painting/ NACE/ equivalent and Certified to ASNT level II in RT, PT, MT and UT techniques shall be given preference.* Shall have a minimum of 6 years of relevant inspection experience in oil and gas facility /GRE Pipeline /Piping construction. * Shall be familiar with relevant material, Testing, Instruments used & construction/works codes used in the industry & field of activity.Duties & Responsibilities:* Implementation, and monitoring of the Project specific Contract Quality Plan/ITP/QCP etc.* Witness procedures, Bonder qualifications, tests and certify the results.* Maintaining of Quality records & assists in preparation of Hand over package/ dossiers.* Reporting Quality activities, monitor performance indicators.* Liaison with Client representatives on matters related to Quality.* Assists in Auditing - internal and external, and follow up of Corrective Actions (internal & external).* Monitor & Control of Sub-Contractorâ€™s Activities and their quality performance.* Provide sufficient feedback to QA/QC Engineer on the day-to-day quality issues# Job Location: Oman, Site Based# Job Duration: Long Term (2+ Years)# Salary: As per Company standard, based on years of experience, current/last CTC# Other Benefits: To and Fro Air Tickets, food, accommodation, transportation, medicals, leave salary and gratuity.* Interested candidates meeting the qualification and experience criteria are invited to submit their updated resumes to career@everserveconsultants.com.Follow Naveen Kanchan & EverServe Consultants Private Limited, for great opportunities!hashtag#jobvacancy hashtag#omanjobs hashtag#jobhiring hashtag#oilandgasjobs hashtag#constructionjobs hashtag#qaqc hashtag#inspectors hashtag#quality hashtag#qajobs hashtag#gre hashtag#glassreinforcedepoxy

Majority Of Canadians say refugees receive too many benefits A growing number of Canadians believe refugees and asylum seekers receive excessive government benefits, according to internal research by the Canadian Museum for Human Rights. Blacklock's Reporter says the findings align with a decline in public support for high immigration levels, as documented by the Department of Immigration.A report titledÂ Foresights For Human Rights: 2024 Preliminary Reportfound that 56% of respondents felt refugees and asylum seekers were granted too many benefits. Additionally, 41% believed there was too much emphasis on newcomersâ€™ rights.Public sentiment about immigrationâ€™s impact has shifted significantly. When asked if â€œimmigrants make the country better,â€ only 44% agreed, down from 52% the previous year. The report noted a growing perception that immigration is linked to economic strain. â€œMore research is needed to understand the roots of this trend,â€ it stated.The study also found that 84% of respondents agreed with the statement: â€œRefugee applicants receive too many benefits that would be better used by Canadians.â€Read Article:https://lnkd.in/dauksgKchashtag#Opines on hashtag#CanadianPolitics hashtag#CanadianImmigrationhashtag#STOPMASSIMMIGRATIONhashtag#CanadianOpiner by hashtag#OpineMediaGroup

We are hashtag#hiring for a leading Oil and Gas Construction Company in Oman.Designation: GRE- QC InspectorVacancies: 03 Nos.Qualification & Experience:* Shall be a Graduate/Diploma Engineer in Mechanical/Metallurgical or equivalent discipline. * Experienced in GRE Bonding & Lamination works & trained by reputed GRE manufacturers like FGS/ CPI/ FPI etc.* Having PDO approval / Project experience will be an added advantage.* Certification as CSWIP 3.1 or AWS / BGAS painting/ NACE/ equivalent and Certified to ASNT level II in RT, PT, MT and UT techniques shall be given preference.* Shall have a minimum of 6 years of relevant inspection experience in oil and gas facility /GRE Pipeline /Piping construction. * Shall be familiar with relevant material, Testing, Instruments used & construction/works codes used in the industry & field of activity.Duties & Responsibilities:* Implementation, and monitoring of the Project specific Contract Quality Plan/ITP/QCP etc.* Witness procedures, Bonder qualifications, tests and certify the results.* Maintaining of Quality records & assists in preparation of Hand over package/ dossiers.* Reporting Quality activities, monitor performance indicators.* Liaison with Client representatives on matters related to Quality.* Assists in Auditing - internal and external, and follow up of Corrective Actions (internal & external).* Monitor & Control of Sub-Contractorâ€™s Activities and their quality performance.* Provide sufficient feedback to QA/QC Engineer on the day-to-day quality issues# Job Location: Oman, Site Based# Job Duration: Long Term (2+ Years)# Salary: As per Company standard, based on years of experience, current/last CTC# Other Benefits: To and Fro Air Tickets, food, accommodation, transportation, medicals, leave salary and gratuity.* Interested candidates meeting the qualification and experience criteria are invited to submit their updated resumes to career@everserveconsultants.com.Follow Naveen Kanchan & EverServe Consultants Private Limited, for great opportunities!hashtag#jobvacancy hashtag#omanjobs hashtag#jobhiring hashtag#oilandgasjobs hashtag#constructionjobs hashtag#qaqc hashtag#inspectors hashtag#quality hashtag#qajobs hashtag#gre hashtag#glassreinforcedepoxy

Majority Of Canadians say refugees receive too many benefits A growing number of Canadians believe refugees and asylum seekers receive excessive government benefits, according to internal research by the Canadian Museum for Human Rights. Blacklock's Reporter says the findings align with a decline in public support for high immigration levels, as documented by the Department of Immigration.A report titledÂ Foresights For Human Rights: 2024 Preliminary Reportfound that 56% of respondents felt refugees and asylum seekers were granted too many benefits. Additionally, 41% believed there was too much emphasis on newcomersâ€™ rights.Public sentiment about immigrationâ€™s impact has shifted significantly. When asked if â€œimmigrants make the country better,â€ only 44% agreed, down from 52% the previous year. The report noted a growing perception that immigration is linked to economic strain. â€œMore research is needed to understand the roots of this trend,â€ it stated.The study also found that 84% of respondents agreed with the statement: â€œRefugee applicants receive too many benefits that would be better used by Canadians.â€Read Article:https://lnkd.in/dauksgKchashtag#Opines on hashtag#CanadianPolitics hashtag#CanadianImmigrationhashtag#STOPMASSIMMIGRATIONhashtag#CanadianOpiner by hashtag#OpineMediaGroup

We are hashtag#hiring for a leading Oil and Gas Construction Company in Oman.Designation: GRE- QC InspectorVacancies: 03 Nos.Qualification & Experience:* Shall be a Graduate/Diploma Engineer in Mechanical/Metallurgical or equivalent discipline. * Experienced in GRE Bonding & Lamination works & trained by reputed GRE manufacturers like FGS/ CPI/ FPI etc.* Having PDO approval / Project experience will be an added advantage.* Certification as CSWIP 3.1 or AWS / BGAS painting/ NACE/ equivalent and Certified to ASNT level II in RT, PT, MT and UT techniques shall be given preference.* Shall have a minimum of 6 years of relevant inspection experience in oil and gas facility /GRE Pipeline /Piping construction. * Shall be familiar with relevant material, Testing, Instruments used & construction/works codes used in the industry & field of activity.Duties & Responsibilities:* Implementation, and monitoring of the Project specific Contract Quality Plan/ITP/QCP etc.* Witness procedures, Bonder qualifications, tests and certify the results.* Maintaining of Quality records & assists in preparation of Hand over package/ dossiers.* Reporting Quality activities, monitor performance indicators.* Liaison with Client representatives on matters related to Quality.* Assists in Auditing - internal and external, and follow up of Corrective Actions (internal & external).* Monitor & Control of Sub-Contractorâ€™s Activities and their quality performance.* Provide sufficient feedback to QA/QC Engineer on the day-to-day quality issues# Job Location: Oman, Site Based# Job Duration: Long Term (2+ Years)# Salary: As per Company standard, based on years of experience, current/last CTC# Other Benefits: To and Fro Air Tickets, food, accommodation, transportation, medicals, leave salary and gratuity.* Interested candidates meeting the qualification and experience criteria are invited to submit their updated resumes to career@everserveconsultants.com.Follow Naveen Kanchan & EverServe Consultants Private Limited, for great opportunities!hashtag#jobvacancy hashtag#omanjobs hashtag#jobhiring hashtag#oilandgasjobs hashtag#constructionjobs hashtag#qaqc hashtag#inspectors hashtag#quality hashtag#qajobs hashtag#gre hashtag#glassreinforcedepoxy

Majority Of Canadians say refugees receive too many benefits A growing number of Canadians believe refugees and asylum seekers receive excessive government benefits, according to internal research by the Canadian Museum for Human Rights. Blacklock's Reporter says the findings align with a decline in public support for high immigration levels, as documented by the Department of Immigration.A report titledÂ Foresights For Human Rights: 2024 Preliminary Reportfound that 56% of respondents felt refugees and asylum seekers were granted too many benefits. Additionally, 41% believed there was too much emphasis on newcomersâ€™ rights.Public sentiment about immigrationâ€™s impact has shifted significantly. When asked if â€œimmigrants make the country better,â€ only 44% agreed, down from 52% the previous year. The report noted a growing perception that immigration is linked to economic strain. â€œMore research is needed to understand the roots of this trend,â€ it stated.The study also found that 84% of respondents agreed with the statement: â€œRefugee applicants receive too many benefits that would be better used by Canadians.â€Read Article:https://lnkd.in/dauksgKchashtag#Opines on hashtag#CanadianPolitics hashtag#CanadianImmigrationhashtag#STOPMASSIMMIGRATIONhashtag#CanadianOpiner by hashtag#OpineMediaGroup

Username: EverServe Consultants Private LimitedEverServe Consultants Private Limited

We are hashtag#hiring for a leading Oil and Gas Construction Company in Oman.Designation: GRE- QC InspectorVacancies: 03 Nos.Qualification & Experience:* Shall be a Graduate/Diploma Engineer in Mechanical/Metallurgical or equivalent discipline. * Experienced in GRE Bonding & Lamination works & trained by reputed GRE manufacturers like FGS/ CPI/ FPI etc.* Having PDO approval / Project experience will be an added advantage.* Certification as CSWIP 3.1 or AWS / BGAS painting/ NACE/ equivalent and Certified to ASNT level II in RT, PT, MT and UT techniques shall be given preference.* Shall have a minimum of 6 years of relevant inspection experience in oil and gas facility /GRE Pipeline /Piping construction. * Shall be familiar with relevant material, Testing, Instruments used & construction/works codes used in the industry & field of activity.Duties & Responsibilities:* Implementation, and monitoring of the Project specific Contract Quality Plan/ITP/QCP etc.* Witness procedures, Bonder qualifications, tests and certify the results.* Maintaining of Quality records & assists in preparation of Hand over package/ dossiers.* Reporting Quality activities, monitor performance indicators.* Liaison with Client representatives on matters related to Quality.* Assists in Auditing - Majority Of Canadians say refugees receive too many benefits A growing number of Canadians believe refugees and asylum seekers receive excessive government benefits, according to internal research by the Canadian Museum for Human Rights. Blacklock's Reporter says the findings align with a decline in public support for high immigration levels, as documented by the Department of Immigration.A report titledÂ Foresights For Human Rights: 2024 Preliminary Reportfound that 56% of respondents felt refugees and asylum seekers were granted too many benefits. Additionally, 41% believed there was too much emphasis on newcomersâ€™ rights.Public sentiment about immigrationâ€™s impact has shifted significantly. When asked if â€œimmigrants make the country better,â€ only 44% agreed, down from 52% the previous year. The report noted a growing perception that immigration is linked to economic strain. â€œMore research is needed to understand the roots of this trend,â€ it stated.The study also found that 84% of respondents agreed with the statement: â€œRefugee applicants receive too many benefits that would be better used by Canadians.â€Read Article:https://lnkd.in/dauksgKchashtag#Opines on hashtag#CanadianPolitics hashtag#CanadianImmigrationhashtag#STOPMASSIMMIGRATIONhashtag#CanadianOpiner by hashtag#OpineMediaGroup
